result.execSummary:
The defendant George Freeman Garrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of Out-of-State Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  May not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol.
AODA assessment and compliance with any treatment recommendations.
Mental health evaluation and compliance with any recommendations.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due with interest. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

9:35 AM - cases called - 22CT10 and 22CF79.  Defendant George Freeman Garrett in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerald J. Hersil in court for George Freeman Garrett.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Ellis regarding plea agreement.  Court questions Atty Hersil/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Hersil/Defendant.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Defendant acknowledges the restrictions that go along with a felony conviction.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Joint recommendation.  Statement by Atty Ellis/Atty Hersil/Court regarding sentencing.  Post conviction rights given.

22CT10 -  DRI.

22CF79 - Plea to Count 1 is no contest.  Plea to Count 3 is no contest.  Counts 2 and 4 - DRI.  Court orders s/w 36 months probation with conditions of probation being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages, may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with any treatment recommendations, mental health evaluation and compliance with any recommendations, cc/sc and 12 months license revocation.  225 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.

2:17 PM - case called.  Defendant George Freeman Garrett appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Kurt Zengler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the Defendant.  Statement by the Defendant.  Officer Michael Krich duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Zengler.  Defendant identified by Officer Krich.  No cross by Defendant.  Court questions Officer Krich.  Statement by Defendant.  Argument by Atty Zengler.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Court will not proceed with the arraignment to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for a public defender.  Statement by Defendant regarding bond modification.  Rebuttal by Atty Zengler.  Statement by the Court.  Court denies motion to modify bond.
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:00 am.
